chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Alexander J Blunt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Joint & several with co-defendant Matthew R. Newton, Shawano Co Case 14CF162.
25% of prison wages to apply toward restitution.
Additional 30 days to determine additional restitution.

Full time work (32 hrs/wk) or 5 job searches per week.
AODA evaluation and followthrough.
$50.00 minimum payments on obligations once released from custody.
$10 fine + costs ordered to run concurrent with prison sentence.
To be eligible for ERP or CIP after 6 months.

Defendant Alexander J Blunt in court with attorney David C. Rashid.  Defendant Alexander J Blunt in custody.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea questionnaire given to the Court.    Defendant enters a plea of no contest to count 1.
